Ask HN: As a SaaS company, how do you manage your single-tenant deployments?
text:
My use case - you are a SaaS company that has "main" multitenant deployment that serves your customers.

Then you have an enterprise prospect that wants a single-tenant deployment due to security, privacy, etc.

Is there any tool that will help me achieve that? Both spinning up the single-tenant deployment and verifying it works.

There's replicated for kubernetes-native apps but let's say I use also third parties such as Snowflake and some other managed services.

Ask HN: Receiving Offers for My Companies
text:
I'm running a private software company in a very niche ( and localized) space, with just a handful of staff. We achieve at most arithmetic growth at our revenue. I don't foresee that anyone would be interested in acquiring my company precisely because it's very niche and localized and doesn't have the kind of hockey stick growth that a buyer would salivate at.

But then, I received an email out of the blue today, reproduce here ( with names redacted):

~~~~~

We are part of a large publicly traded company with a market cap of ~USDXX B+ that operates on a ‘hold forever’ principle. My understanding is that your company serves as a niche solution in the software space. I’m reaching out to express our interest towards your business and also introduce ourselves

So far, we have acquired hundreds of businesses that operate autonomously across the world with a presence in numerous software verticals. We operate these businesses in a decentralized manner which means that they are still being run and operated by their original management teams and employees where it makes sense for them, with our backing, capital and expertise. At this point in time, I am hoping to get in touch with you and possibly start discussing any exit plans, whenever the timing is right for you, now or down the line in a few years.

~~~~

I don't quite understand why people would want to acquire my company, especially if they know about the nicheness of our space ( and judging from the email, they do). When it comes to M&A, shouldn’t they focus on companies with great growth prospects ( like social media in the early days), or the ones in their adjacent fields that they can contribute meaningful expertise and opportunities to (like Autodesk acquisition of PlanGrid)?

Could this be a scam?

What do you think? Anyone had such an experience?

title: Everything you should know about certificates and PKI but are too afraid to ask
Ask HN: Camunda 8 Bpmn – Thoughts?
text:
I have to say, I am disappointed in the direction of Camunda 8 for the two reasons listed below.

1) BREAKING CHANGES: There are a lot of breaking changes that will be hard or time consuming to migrate. I agree with the general philosophy of the design decisions -- such as making each service essentially run as a job. However, it is simply not feasible to migrate a large application away given the number of breaking changes.

2) LICENSE: The new license structure is confusing, and not as permissive as Camunda 7s.

It sort of feels like they are trying to force everyone into their SAAS solution or into a paying customer. They do, however, have every right to do this.

Am I missing something with the direction of Camunda? What is a good alternative, specifically with great integration to Java? Thanks

Ask HN: Looking for a first customer for a time blocking web app
text:
I've made a webapp for time blocking, because none of the project-tracking/todo-list apps I've seen really let you see your active projects alongside your calendar.

I like to think of it as a way to budget one's time. We budget our money, why not our time?

At the moment it's pretty basic, essentially just a proof of concept, but you can play around with it: www.timeblocker.dev

What I'm looking for is a first user/customer, or maybe a couple if there should be so much interest! I'm looking for someone who can give feedback and help set the direction for the product.

You will get all features free forever! No matter what pricing level we end up implementing, as our base customer I value your feedback more than anything else, so you will always get free access, even if you're no longer giving me feedback.

I guess HN doesn't have DM's so just say you're interested and leave your email in your profile and I'll reach out to you.

text:
